sentence.text: The maggot-bearing stapelia from southern Africa not only reeks dreadfully of carrion but reinforces its appeal to flies by producing flowers with wrinkled brown petals covered with hairs that look like the decaying skin of a dead animal .
I noticed she reeked powerfully of fat and roast cooking .
` Your morals might reek of the dustbin , but the scenery is magnificent . "
The whole place reeked of damp .
Others reeked of herbs or were powdered with flour .
Samson yowled , let go , and she was over the back of the counter crouching down , pushing and wriggling through stinking legs and skirts that reeked of an unwashed lifetime .
The room reeked of the cheap perfume worn by the blowzy woman who was vacating it as we arrived .
Not so in Aachen , or anywhere in the old Federal Republic where the townscapes are sprightly and well kept , the public parks devoid of litter and the shopping malls reek of prosperity .
There is something about this place which reeks of ancient sin and , the sooner our task is completed , the better . "
It reeked of wet straw and stale horse manure , and the old nag the lad fetched smelled sweaty .
This is all a huge improvement on 10 years ago when the children practised their chess in a two-roomed flat with one wall reeking with damp .
Three great avenues radiated away , choked with fighting , reeking with smoke .
` That 's why some people reek after garlic and some do n't -- it relates to their metabolism . "
